<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>As a means of normalizing “not having plans” on holiday weekends, I'd like to declare that I do not have any plans this weekend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, besides going to the US Open today. If you’re also heading over to Queens, give me a shout. We can shake hands, wave from a distance...whatever people do these days.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/delta-crashes-jobs-party?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Delta Crashes the Jobs Party
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/delta-crashes-jobs-party?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Crashing through a window" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l1J3MSRDWd2wTO0Wk/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47qbof7rmqjmhj0m5ogvjon1sfwz7mrbyimat56nc3&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Crashing through a window" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l1J3MSRDWd2wTO0Wk/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47qbof7rmqjmhj0m5ogvjon1sfwz7mrbyimat56nc3&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The August jobs report fell flatter than a high schooler’s rendition of “Defying Gravity.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US employers added <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/03/jobs-report-august-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 235,000 jobs</a> last month, compared to the 720,000 expected. Hiring was expected to fall from the 1.1 million jobs added in July and 962,000 in June, but nowhere near this much. It was the smallest employment gain in seven months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>All our fears that Delta would slow the labor market’s recovery came true. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Leisure and hospitality, a sector that falters when Covid anxieties are higher, reported no job increases last month. It was averaging 350,000 new jobs a month over the past six months.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other industries that require in-person interaction also suffered. Restaurants lost 42,000 jobs, and retailers lost 29,000.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So which parts of the economy added jobs?</strong> Professional and business services, manufacturing, and transportation—industries that are not nearly as affected by the pandemic as those in hospitality.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In total, there are 5.6 million fewer workers holding jobs in the US now than before the pandemic hit.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happens next?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This jobs report whiff will reverberate around DC. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Biden administration will use it to show the economy </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/biden-jobs-report-delta-30c97cb4-c00e-4c51-91f3-e943ea52c79d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still needs more support</a></span><span> from the government, while urging the passage of the $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill and a $3.5 trillion spending package.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It also could delay the Fed’s plan to wind down its pandemic-era stimulus measures, which Chair Jerome Powell indicated would begin this fall.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the extra $300/week in federal unemployment benefits will expire this weekend for all the states that hadn’t ended them early. <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/states-that-cut-unemployment-benefits-saw-limited-impact-on-job-growth-11630488601?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Studies show</a> that it’s not likely to bring about major hiring increases, so don’t get your hopes up for a huge jobs rebound in September. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/booster-vaccine-doses-turn-threeshot-circus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boosters Turn Into a Three-Shot Circus
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/booster-vaccine-doses-turn-threeshot-circus?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzcxL3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When it comes to rolling out Covid-19 vaccine booster shots, the Biden administration may have put the cart before the horse, counted its chickens before they hatched, ran before it—you get the point.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Federal health officials, including the acting commissioner of the FDA and the director of the CDC, have reportedly told the White House to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/03/us/coronavirus-booster-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scale back</a> its plan to offer third vaccine shots later this month until they can review more data.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>President Biden announced that Americans who received Pfizer’s or Moderna’s vaccine could <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2021/09/03/booster-shot-delay-pfizer-first/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begin</a> getting their third shots the week of Sept. 20, as long as it had been at least eight months since they got their second shot.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in a meeting at the White House this week, health leaders said those initial boosters might need to be limited to just those who got Pfizer’s vaccine, per reports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The necessity of third shots is still dividing the scientific community. While Dr. Fauci said this week that a third shot is “<a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/03/health/us-coronavirus-friday/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">very likely</a>” needed for a full regimen, other experts say there isn’t enough evidence yet to justify launching boosters. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/apples-crazy-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple's Crazy Week
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Gold Apple" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTU1L2dvbGRfYXBwbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While many companies tried to make as little news as possible this week, Apple had one of the busiest stretches of the year. Let’s do this <em>Memento</em>-style and work backward. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yesterday: </strong>Apple said it would <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/apple-take-more-time-roll-out-child-safety-features-2021-09-03/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delay</a> the rollout of its new software that scans devices for child sexual abuse content so it can make improvements. The tech had come under fire from privacy advocates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>A legal double whammy. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A judge </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/09/02/apple-siri-lawsuit-privacy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">refused to throw out</a></span><span> a lawsuit that accuses Apple’s Siri of recording private conversations and sending them to third parties. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Financial Times also reported that the US National Labor Relations Board is </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/484fa8be-925e-495c-91ff-54950b112754?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigating</a></span><span> allegations that Apple retaliated against a senior engineer who complained about a harmful workplace.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Apple offered its second App Store concession in less than a week, allowing companies like Netflix and Spotify to direct users to payment methods outside of the App Store. It also announced the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/apple-will-add-state-ids-digital-wallet-states?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beginning of the end</a> for the physical wallet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Apple is trying to minimize damage to its lucrative App Store as it looks to the bigger picture—the expected launch of its newest iPhone model this month. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/key-performance-indicators-september-4?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="BADEN-BADEN, GERMANY - FEBRUARY 04: Banksy's " Love In The Bin" is on vie..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83Mjg2L2JhbmtzeV9zX2xvdmVfaW5fdGhlX2Jpbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alexander Scheuber/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Remember in 2018 when Banksy’s famous “Girl With Balloon” painting self-destructed after being bought at auction for $1.4 million? That <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2021/sep/03/shredded-banksy-artwork-goes-back-under-hammer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">half-shredded</a> painting, now known as “Love is in the Bin,” will be sold by Sotheby’s on October 14. Experts estimate it could sell for up to $8.3 million, or six times its previous selling price. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Just bought my first ETH! Let’s do this #cryptotwitter”</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/musicals-waitress-hadestown-return-broadway?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sugar, Butter, and Flower Returns to Broadway
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/musicals-waitress-hadestown-return-broadway?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Sara Bareilles performing in Waitress on Broadway" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83Mjg1L3NhcmFfYmFyZWlsbGVzX3BlcmZvcm1pbmdfaW5fd2FpdHJlc3Nfb25fYnJvYWR3YXkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Bruce Glikas/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Finally, some hopeful news to all of us who ate our high school lunches in the band room: Musicals <em>Waitress </em>and <em>Hadestown</em> returned to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/02/theater/broadway-reopening-hadestown-waitress.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold-out Broadway theaters</a> Thursday night. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Covid has been more damaging for the musical theater industry than Russell Crowe’s turn as Javert. Broadway shut down its 41 theaters on March 12, 2020, devastating those who work in the sector as well as the Midtown Manhattan businesses supported by them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which is why Broadway’s return is so critical for NYC’s recovery, both economically and emotionally. In fact, the crowd was so overwhelmed with joy at <em>Waitress </em>that they gave a standing ovation to a prerecorded message telling them to keep their masks on, per the NYT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Broadway’s return will really pick up steam on September 14, when heavyweights <em>The Lion King</em>,<em> Hamilton</em>,<em> Wicked</em>,<em> </em>and <em>Chicago</em> will restart performances. </p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe August jobs report fell flatter than a high schooler’s rendition of “Defying Gravity.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS employers added \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/03/jobs-report-august-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust 235,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e last month, compared to the 720,000 expected. Hiring was expected to fall from the 1.1 million jobs added in July and 962,000 in June, but nowhere near this much. It was the smallest employment gain in seven months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eAll our fears that Delta would slow the labor market’s recovery came true. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLeisure and hospitality, a sector that falters when Covid anxieties are higher, reported no job increases last month. It was averaging 350,000 new jobs a month over the past six months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther industries that require in-person interaction also suffered. Restaurants lost 42,000 jobs, and retailers lost 29,000.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo which parts of the economy added jobs?\u003c/strong\u003e Professional and business services, manufacturing, and transportation—industries that are not nearly as affected by the pandemic as those in hospitality.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn total, there are 5.6 million fewer workers holding jobs in the US now than before the pandemic hit.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happens next?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis jobs report whiff will reverberate around DC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Biden administration will use it to show the economy \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/biden-jobs-report-delta-30c97cb4-c00e-4c51-91f3-e943ea52c79d.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill needs more support\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from the government, while urging the passage of the $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill and a $3.5 trillion spending package.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt also could delay the Fed’s plan to wind down its pandemic-era stimulus measures, which Chair Jerome Powell indicated would begin this fall.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe extra $300/week in federal unemployment benefits will expire this weekend for all the states that hadn’t ended them early. \u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eStudies show\u003c/a\u003e that it’s not likely to bring about major hiring increases, so don’t get your hopes up for a style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen it comes to rolling out Covid-19 vaccine booster shots, the Biden administration may have put the cart before the horse, counted its chickens before they hatched, ran before it—you get the point.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFederal health officials, including the acting commissioner of the FDA and the director of the CDC, have reportedly told the White House to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/03/us/coronavirus-booster-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escale back\u003c/a\u003e its plan to offer third vaccine shots later this month until they can review more data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003ePresident Biden announced that Americans who received Pfizer’s or Moderna’s vaccine could \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2021/09/03/booster-shot-delay-pfizer-first/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegin\u003c/a\u003e getting their third shots the week of Sept. 20, as long as it had been at least eight months since they got their second shot.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in a meeting at the White House this week, health leaders said those initial boosters might need to be limited to just those who got Pfizer’s vaccine, per reports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe necessity of third shots is still dividing the scientific community. While Dr. Fauci said this week that a third shot is “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/03/health/us-coronavirus-friday/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003every likely\u003c/a\u003e” needed for a full regimen, other experts say there isn’t enough evidence yet to justify launching boosters. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F09%2F03%2Fbooster-vaccine-doses-turn-threeshot-circus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Let’s do this \u003cem\u003eMemento\u003c/em\u003e-style and work backward. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYesterday: \u003c/strong\u003eApple said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/apple-take-more-time-roll-out-child-safety-features-2021-09-03/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelay\u003c/a\u003e the rollout of its new software that scans devices for child sexual abuse content so it can make improvements. The tech had come under fire from privacy advocates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThursday: \u003c/strong\u003eA legal double whammy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA judge \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/09/02/apple-siri-lawsuit-privacy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erefused to throw out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a lawsuit that accuses Apple’s Siri of recording private conversations and sending them to third parties. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Financial Times also reported that the US National Labor Relations Board is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/484fa8be-925e-495c-91ff-54950b112754?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvestigating\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e allegations that Apple retaliated against a senior engineer who complained about a harmful workplace.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWednesday: \u003c/strong\u003eApple offered its second App Store concession in less than a week, allowing companies like Netflix and Spotify to direct users to payment methods outside of the App Store. It also announced the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/apple-will-add-state-ids-digital-wallet-states?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeginning of the end\u003c/a\u003e for the physical wallet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eApple is trying to minimize damage to its lucrative App Store as it looks to the bigger picture—the expected launch of its newest iPhone model this month. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
